result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter A. Hrycenko

Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Peter A. Hrycenko.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Erickson has no information on defendant's non-appearance

State requests a warrant be issued and takes no position on bond out
Comments by Atty. Erickson - 

Court authorizes a warrant - def. to be held for bond hearing.
jury instruction for obstruction

Attorney Erickson is heard and requests a plea and sentencing.

4:04 PM Defendant Peter A Hrycenko appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Matthew Allen on behalf of Atty. Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 
     Court finds probable cause.  Atty. Allen requests $500 signature bond with standard conditions, plus absolute sobriety.
     Def. comments.
     Court sets $500 signature bond; not possess/consume any alcohol, no enter any taverns; upon request of L.E., to submit to PBT or other testing to determine compliance.  Def. states he works at Eddie's.  Court allows bond to state except in connection with employment of Eddie's Irish Pub.  Prob. & Parole may continue their hold.  Advised of right to an attorney.
Court concludes at 4:10 p.m.
Hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages nor enter any taverns, except in connection with employment of Eddie's Irish Pub. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.
